intro: Drimiopsis holstii, commonly known as the Holst's drimiopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of fleshy, dark green leaves. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom in late winter to early spring. It is well adapted to dry conditions and thrives in well-drained soil. Drimiopsis holstii is popular among succulent enthusiasts for its ornamental value and ease of care.
